alert.note: Alert for Duval; La Salle; McMullen; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 13 at 2:10PM CDT until August 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS REMAINS IN THE BRUSH COUNTRY AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... .Current southeasterly wind gusts are 20 to 25 mph, expected to increase to 30 to 35 mph once the sea breeze pushes through early this evening. Relative humidity in the 30s will reach a minimum around 22 percent across the Brush Country. Strong gusty winds, low relative humidity, and dry to critically dry fuels will continue to result in critical fire weather conditions through this evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR THE BRUSH COUNTRY AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle, McMullen, Webb and Duval. * TIMING...From noon to 8 PM CDT today * WINDS...Southeast 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 23 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 108. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
